newsitem.title: LATVIA: Latvian Pareks in finance deal with Kursk region.
newsitem.headline: Latvian Pareks in finance deal with Kursk region.

text.p: Leading Latvian bank Pareks Banka on Thursday said it has agreed to arrange financial services for the Russian region of Kursk under which it will lend 130 billion roubles ($22.5 million) and arrange the issue of bonds.

"The bank has undertaken to grant a loan for a total amount of 130 billion roubles ... as well as assist in the issue and placement of municipal bonds and producing an international credit rating for the region," Pareks said in a statement.
It said it transferred an initial tranche of 65 billion roubles this week. The aim of the tranche is to buy 200 grain harvesters from the Rosselmash factory. The repayment period is six months.

Pareks said the financing of the Kursk region was the bank's third major project after arranging a 12 million lats loan to Latvian state telecoms firm Lattelekom and completing the primary placement of municipal bonds for the Ukrainian city of Odessa worth 30 million hryvnias.
-- Patrick Lannin, Riga newsroom, +371 721 5240 ($ = 5775 Russian Roubles)
